Class DataPreprocessor

java.lang.Object
DataPreprocessor
public class DataPreprocessor extends Object
Responsible for processing data in an AI context. Has several utility methods for data preprocessing.

      public DataPreprocessor()

  • Method Details

    • normalize

      public static void normalize(String dataFile, String normalizedFile, String separator) throws IOException
      normalizes data from a file, and places it onto another file.
      Parameters:
      dataFile - the file to read the data from
      normalizedFile - the file to write the normalized data to
      separator - the string that separates the values to normalize in each line
      Throws:
      IOException

    • cropEdges

      public static void cropEdges(String datafile, String writefile, String separator, int rows, int ammount) throws IOException
      crops the edges of images saved in a file and saves the output into a file. each image should be a row in the file, and each value in a line should be a single pixel
      Parameters:
      datafile - the file path of the image to crop
      writefile - the file path of where the output should be saved to
      separator - the separator of each pixel in a row
      rows - how many rows of pixels each image has (NOT HOW MANY IMAGES THERE ARE)
      ammount - the ammount of pixels to crop (on every side)
      Throws:
      IOException - if an IO error occurs.

    • ditheringNoise

      public static void ditheringNoise(String datafile, String writefile, String separator) throws IOException
      Performs a dithering-like noise to each image on a file, deleting every other pixel
      Parameters:
      datafile - the file path where the images are encoded in (each row should contain an image)
      writefile - the file to save the output to
      separator - the separator between each pixel for each image
      Throws:
      IOException - if an IO error occurs

    • getValuesFromFile

      public static ArrayList<ArrayList<Double>> getValuesFromFile(String file, String separator) throws IOException
      Gets all the (double) values from a file, the outer list contains each row, the inner list contains each element of a row
      Parameters:
      file - the file path where the values are
      separator - the separator of each element on a given row of the file
      Returns:
      the values on the file
      Throws:
      IOException - if an IO error occurs

    • shuffleRows

      public static void shuffleRows(double[][] matrix)
      shuffles the rows of a double[][] matrix.
      Parameters:
      matrix - the matrix to shuffle (inplace)

    • shuffleRowsPreserve

      public static void shuffleRowsPreserve(double[][] matrix0, double[][] matrix1)
      shuffles two matrix, preserving the relationship between their rows. for example, if the 7th row in the original matrix is placed in index 5, the 7th row of the other matrix will also be placed inn index 5.
      Parameters:
      matrix0 - the first matrix to shuffle (inplace)
      matrix1 - the second matrix to shuffle (inplace)

    • readMatrix

      public static double[][] readMatrix(String file, String separator) throws IOException
      reads a double[][] matrix from a file where each line is a row.
      Parameters:
      file - the file to read the matrix from
      separator - the column separator in the file
      Returns:
      the matrix read
      Throws:
      IOException - when an IO error occurs

    • getNumLines

      public static int getNumLines(String file) throws IOException
      gets the number of lines from a file.
      Parameters:
      file - the file to get the number of lines from
      Returns:
      the number of lines from a file
      Throws:
      IOException - when an IO error occurs.

    • getSplitSetsFromDataset

      public static Matrix[] getSplitSetsFromDataset(double[][] inputs, double[][] outputs, double trainingToTestingRatio)
      gets the inputs / target outputs (dataset) and splits it according to the trainingToTestingRatio.
      Parameters:
      inputs - the inputs of the neural network (each row is an input, is column is an element of the input)
      outputs - the outputs of the neural network (each row in a target output, a column is an element of the output)
      trainingToTestingRatio - the ratio of training to testing (should be between 0 and 1)
      Returns:
      an array with 4 elements: [0 = training set], [1 = training set target output], [2 - testing set], [3 - testing set target output]
